summary.text:
Base interface for all view modifiers.
All modifiers must have a type field and can include arbitrary parameters.
Adds a delay before the animation starts (in seconds).
Repeats the animation the given number of times.
Extra bounce to apply to the spring animation.
The damping applied to the spring.
The initial velocity of the animation.
The mass attached to the spring.

Presentation detent type for controlling sheet heights.
-

: Fraction of screen height (0-1, for example, 0.4 equals to 40% of screen)
-
The duration over which to blend between animations (in seconds).
Extra bounce to apply to the spring animation.
The amount of damping applied to the spring's motion.

Text view to display as a badge. Set the value to nil to hide the badge.
The prominence to apply to badges associated with this environment.

Makes text bold.
When applied to
, it works on all iOS/tvOS versions. When used on regular views, it requires iOS 16.0+/tvOS 16.0+.

The border parameters. Color and width.

Inverts the colors of a view.
Positions this view within an invisible frame with a size relative to the nearest container.

Factory function to create modifier configuration objects.
This is used by all built-in modifier functions and can be used by 3rd party libraries to create custom modifiers.

Sets the foreground color/tint of a view.

Sets the foreground style of a view with comprehensive styling options.

Replaces the deprecated

modifier with enhanced capabilities including
colors, gradients, and semantic hierarchical styles that adapt to system appearance.

content.text: A view modifier that applies the specified foreground style

summary.text:
The foreground style configuration. Can be:

**Simple Color (string):**
- Hex colors:

**Hierarchical Styles (Semantic):**
Auto-adapting semantic styles that respond to light/dark mode and accessibility settings:

```ts
{ type: 'hierarchical', style: 'primary' }    // Most prominent (main content, headlines)
{ type: 'hierarchical', style: 'secondary' }  // Supporting text, subheadlines
{ type: 'hierarchical', style: 'tertiary' }   // Less important text, captions
{ type: 'hierarchical', style: 'quaternary' } // Subtle text, disabled states
{ type: 'hierarchical', style: 'quinary' }    // Most subtle (iOS 16+, fallback to quaternary)
```

```ts
{
  type: 'linearGradient',
  colors: ['#FF0000', '#0000FF', '#00FF00'],
  startPoint: { x: 0, y: 0 },    // Top-left
  endPoint: { x: 1, y: 1 }       // Bottom-right
}
```

```ts
{
  type: 'radialGradient',
  colors: ['#FF0000', '#0000FF'],
  center: { x: 0.5, y: 0.5 },    // Center of view
  startRadius: 0,                // Inner radius
  endRadius: 100                 // Outer radius
}
```

```ts
{
  type: 'angularGradient',
  colors: ['#FF0000', '#00FF00', '#0000FF'],
  center: { x: 0.5, y: 0.5 }     // Rotation center
}
```
Sets the frame properties of a view.
The frame parameters. Width, height, minWidth, maxWidth, minHeight, maxHeight, idealWidth, idealHeight and alignment.
Sets the style for the gauge.
Applies a glass effect to a view.
The glass effect parameters. Variant, interactive, tint and shape.
Associates an identity value to Liquid Glass effects defined within a
The id of the glass effect.
The namespace id of the glass effect. Use Namespace component to create a namespace.
Specifies a custom alignment anchor for a view that acts as a grid cell.

content.text: A view that uses the specified anchor point to align its content.

summary.text: The unit point that defines how to align the view within the bounds of its grid cell.
Tells a view that acts as a cell in a grid to span the specified number of columns.

content.text: A view that occupies the specified number of columns in a grid row.

summary.text: The number of columns that the view should consume when placed in a grid row.
Asks grid layouts not to offer the view extra size in the specified axes.

content.text: A view that doesnt ask an enclosing grid for extra size in one or more axes.

summary.text: The dimensions in which the grid shouldnt offer the view a share of any available space. This prevents a flexible view like a Spacer, Divider, or Color from defining the size of a row or column.
Overrides the default horizontal alignment of the grid column that the view appears in.

content.text: A view that uses the specified horizontal alignment, and that causes all cells in the same column of a grid to use the same alignment.

summary.text: The HorizontalAlignment guide to use for the grid column that the view appears in.

Whether the view should be hidden.

The safe area regions to ignore and the edges to expand into.

Whether interactive dismiss is disabled (default: true).

, it works on all iOS/tvOS versions. When used on regular views, it requires iOS 16.0+/tvOS 16.0+.

Sets the maximum number of lines that text can occupy in the view.
